newsitem.title: INDIA: Delhi shares reverse trend to close lower.
newsitem.headline: Delhi shares reverse trend to close lower.

text.p: DCM Daewoo failed to maintain the recovery momentum it established in early trade on Monday, driving Delhi shares to a lower close as speculators booked profits at higher levels, brokers said.
The Delhi sensitive index closed 1.44 points down at 795.80.

"Despite hectic purchases by domestic financial institutions, speculators were seen booking profits at higher levels which mainly reversed the early upward trend," said Bharat Bhushan of brokers Nu Era Equity.
Reliance Industries dropped 2.30 rupees to 209.45 while TISCO lost 0.70 rupee at 188.65 on increased selling by profit-takers.
DCM Daewoo firmed 2.50 rupees at 48 on buying support from speculators and mutual funds.
State Bank of India ended 1.40 rupees down at 266.60 on alternate bouts of buying and selling.
ACC lost 16 rupees at 2,102 on heavy selling by mutual funds while TELCO rose 1.50 rupees to 491.50.
